comment: Easiest math class I have ever taken before and his lectures were easy to follow and learn! HIGHLY recommend taking him for stats.

I took this class during the summer! It is the easiest math class ever, Professor Green is very straightforward and makes things easier for you and himself. He has clear grading criteria and assigns one quiz every week with 15 questions max. There is homework on Aleks but they were all due on July 15th so he gives you plenty of time to finish them!

This class was probably the easiest college math I'll have to take. Professor Green provides a lot of resources, such as filled in notes and lecture recordings, that make this class not miserable. Homework is on ALEKS, but luckily everything else is in D2L. Definitely recommend!

Professor Green's class is great. There is about 1 quiz per week (2 attempts each) and also some homework on each topic (graded for completion) that's due on the day the exam is due. I just went over his completed notes and took some brief notes on them. The majority of the course is just understanding how to read questions and use your calculator.
I strongly recommend taking him for stat
Best statistics teacher. Take his class if you can!

I took him for summer classes. I think he's decent; you have to teach yourself everything because his videos are cut off and blurry. Don't even bother emailing him questions because he will not answer. Overall, the class was kind of difficult because I'm bad at math and had to teach myself, but once you get it, it's very easy to pass.

Very straightforward, no frills class. The homework software (ALEKS) can basically teach you the whole course, and the quizzes and tests are easier than the homework. He also has condensed notes available if you're stuck, and every assignment/quiz/test is open note.

My only complaint would be that he does not reply to emails very fast. As far as the class, there is a lot of homework, but you have plenty of time to complete it. There are weekly quizzes, and in my opinion, those are easier than the HW. Definitely, the easiest math class I've taken.

The class is straightforward, lots of homework on ALEKS, quizzes on each chapter/ test for each unit. If you get a certain grade at the end of the semester you do not have to take the final, multiple attempts on assignments too. The lecture quality visually and audibly was horrible so expect to learn everything by yourself. Never responds to emails
One of the best professors at Kennesaw state. hw is on aleks but gives you weeks to do them and gives two attempts of quizzes.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I really liked this class. It is very easy and straightforward. The homework is on ALEKS and is easy as long as you have a TI-84 calculator.

Professor Green has been amazing this semester! He has made it so evident he cares about everyone's well-being and wants everyone to pass. So much so, that he let us take our tests home twice! If you want an easy A, definitely take him. The only downfall is that he doesn't answer emails incredibly often. Overall, he is worth it!

Easy A. Just do the teacher notes along with videos and you will understand the material  You have hw that goes along with each chapter. Quiz over the chapter and test over unit. I definitely would take him again. My class was online.

One of the best math teachers I've taken. I am terrible at math but this class made sense. He posts worksheets with answers and written solutions to use if you want. The homework website we used explained answers and did walk through solutions. He gave lots of chances at extra credit and to boost your grade.

Professor Green is a great professor. You can tell he cares about his students and helping them pass. I took his class Fall 2020 so due the pandemic attendance wasn't mandatory, I wish I went more. Doing this class fully online was difficult but he was always an email away. I would take him again.

For those looking for a review on Mr. Green, here it is. I took him during the Spring 2020 and his class was easier than it couldve been. He cares that his students do succeed, and is pretty lenient with grading things. Hes also open to feedback especially since hes a relatively new professor. If you just want an easy A for stat, take him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things
